sentence.text: By anybody 's reckoning , she still had another week in which to go through agonies about it .
A PATIENT has been left in agony after a hospital cancelled an operation on his legs for the ninth time .
It has become agony for her to live up to the manufactured image of America 's favourite grandmother .
The next few days were agony for Constance , as she waited for the letter to arrive .
It looks like Labour and the Liberal Democrats are set to join forces , adding to the agony for Alan Winmill , who left Labour for the Tories last year .
She saw the agony in him .
For a moment when she looked at him he saw the agony in her eyes , and his resolve wavered .
Their agony in recent months and years has been terrible to behold .
A night out was not complete without a gamble on the station machine , when the agony of nine successive defeats would be replaced by euphoria when you actually got your bar .

This conclusion should not be seen to reflect callous indifference to individuals who have suffered miserably or fatally at the hands of persons committing ` conventional " crimes ; their agony is real and should never be ignored .
It was agony to him to dismiss her .
Another lengthy court battle would be a severe embarrassment for Mr Heseltine and prolong the Government 's agony over the mishandled pit closure programme .
Maybe JTR helped pick up the pieces or did he watch the poor man 's agony from afar ?
The agony of not knowing where , or how their children were , continued .
But that was nothing to the agony of never seeing him again , her heart replied despairingly .
It 's just hitting you harder than most because it 's taken you longer than the rest of us to discover the joys and the agonies of falling in love .

At one moment the boatswain Jack Allgood comes out of a berserk rage to realise that he , a warrant officer , has allowed his hatred of the captain to lead him into mutiny ; the points of physical detail enforce his emotional agony :
She identified with the emotions of the young men she accompanied , including the mental agonies suffered by many after the conflict had ended and they had returned home .
Sister Duffy becomes a patient and suffers agonies over the fate of her love-child , little Peter .
